Today is World Suicide Prevention Day. The Project Aware Counselors wanted to recognize this day by wearing purple.

Why is this day important?

According to the CDC, in the year 2017, suicide was the second leading cause of death for youth between the ages of 10-24.

Listening Ear’s (Isabella County) Crisis Line is 24/7. Their number is 989-772-2918.

The National Suicide Prevention Hotline is 24/7. Their number is 1-800-273-8255.

Please never hesitate to call one of the numbers listed above or contact one of the Project Aware Counselors if you are concerned about your child’s health and saftey!

Dear Parents and Guardians,

This month, Shepherd Middle School students will be participating in the #WhyYouMatter project. The #WhyYouMatter project uses lesson plans and activities to encourage students to consider why they matter and how they impact people around them. Once every middle school student has an answer to the statement “Why you matter” they will write their answer on the whiteboard and be photographed with their reason.

The photographs will be displayed around the school for the Shepherd community, students and their families to view during the Maple Syrup Festival. Through the completion of the #WhyYouMatter project, Shepherd Middle School students will gain confidence, positive self-esteem, and an understanding of why they are a significant part of this world. We are thankful to the Mt. Pleasant Area Community Foundation for helping fund this project.

Go Jays!!
